Interface CrudRepository<T,ID>

Type Parameters:
T - the entity type managed by this repository
ID - the type of the entity's unique identifier
All Known Implementing Classes:
ApplicationRepository, CareerCenterStaffRepository, CompanyRepRepository, InMemoryCrudRepository, InternshipRepository, StudentRepository, WithdrawalRequestRepository
public interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
Generic repository interface for CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.

This interface defines the standard contract for all repository implementations in the internship management system. It provides a consistent API for data access operations across different entity types.

Design Pattern: This follows the Repository pattern, which abstracts data access logic and provides a collection-like interface for domain objects. This enables:

  • Decoupling business logic from data access details
  • Easy testing through mock implementations
  • Flexibility to change underlying storage mechanisms
  • Consistent API across all entities

Type Parameters:

  • T: The entity type (e.g., Student, Internship, Application)
  • ID: The type of the entity's identifier (typically String)

Implementation Notes:

  • All implementations in this system use in-memory storage (Maps)
  • IDs must be stable and unique for each entity
  • save() performs upsert (insert or update)
  • Methods return Optional for single results to handle missing entities gracefully
See Also:
  • InMemoryCrudRepository
  • StudentRepository
  • InternshipRepository
  • ApplicationRepository

  • Method Details

    • findById

      Optional<T> findById(ID id)
      Retrieves an entity by its unique identifier.

      Returns an Optional containing the entity if found, or an empty Optional if no entity with the given ID exists.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the entity to retrieve
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the entity if found, empty otherwise

    • findAll

      List<T> findAll()
      Retrieves all entities in the repository.

      Returns an immutable or defensive copy of all entities to prevent external modification of the repository's internal state.

      Returns:
      a list containing all entities (never null, may be empty)

    • save

      T save(T entity)
      Saves an entity to the repository (insert or update).

      Upsert Behavior:

      • If an entity with the same ID exists, it is replaced (update)
      • If no entity with the ID exists, it is added (insert)

      The entity's ID must not be null when saved.

      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to save (must not be null, ID must not be null)
      Returns:
      the saved entity
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if entity or entity ID is null

    • saveAll

      List<T> saveAll(Iterable<T> entities)
      Saves multiple entities to the repository.

      Convenience method for bulk operations. Each entity is saved using the same upsert logic as save(Object).

      Parameters:
      entities - the entities to save (must not be null)
      Returns:
      a list of all saved entities in the order they were processed

    • deleteById

      void deleteById(ID id)
      Deletes an entity by its unique identifier.

      If no entity with the given ID exists, this method has no effect (does not throw an exception).

      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the entity to delete

    • deleteAllById

      void deleteAllById(Iterable<ID> ids)
      Deletes multiple entities by their identifiers.

      Convenience method for bulk deletion. For each ID, if an entity exists, it is removed; otherwise, that ID is silently ignored.

      Parameters:
      ids - the collection of identifiers for entities to delete

    • deleteAll

      void deleteAll()
      Deletes all entities from the repository.

      Warning: This operation removes all data and cannot be undone. Use with caution, typically only for testing or reset operations.

    • existsById

      boolean existsById(ID id)
      Checks whether an entity with the given identifier exists.

      Useful for validation before attempting to retrieve or modify an entity.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier to check
      Returns:
      true if an entity with this ID exists, false otherwise

    • count

      long count()
      Returns the total number of entities in the repository.

      Useful for statistics, pagination calculations, or validation.

      Returns:
      the count of all entities (never negative)
